document.heading: District of Columbia Residence Doorknob Notice Act of 1985

history.narrative: Law 6-103, the “District of Columbia Residence Doorknob Notice Act of 1985,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-94, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 14, 1986, and January 28, 1986, respectively. Approved without the signature of the Mayor on February 14, 1986, it was assigned Act No. 6-132 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
